messages.content: Hi, can you remove .json files from the summaries?
I'll find where the summaries are generated and exclude `.json` files. Let me first look at the summary generation logic.

{"message": "Found 3 matches", "output": "── forge/session/manager.py:159 ──
     156 |         ".a",
     157 |     }
     158 | 
>>>  159 |     def _should_summarize(self, filepath: str) -> bool:
     160 |         """Check if a file should be summarized (not binary, not forge metadata)"""
     161 |         # Skip forge metadata
     162 |         if filepath.startswith(".forge/"):

── forge/session/manager.py:489 ──
     486 |         # List files through VFS (includes any pending new files)
     487 |         files = self.vfs.list_files()
     488 |         # Filter out forge metadata and binary files
>>>  489 |         files = [f for f in files if self._should_summarize(filepath=f)]
     490 | 
     491 |         # Sort files breadth-first (by path depth, then alphabetically within each level)
     492 |         files.sort(key=lambda f: (self._get_path_depth(f), f))

── forge/session/manager.py:688 ──
     685 | 
     686 |         Returns the summary text, or None if the file shouldn't be summarized.
     687 |         """
>>>  688 |         if not self._should_summarize(filepath):
     689 |             return None
     690 | 
     691 |         # Read content from VFS (includes pending changes)", "success": true, "total_matches": 3}

🔧 **Tool call:** `grep_context`
```json
{
  "include_extensions": [
    ".py"
  ],
  "pattern": "_should_summarize"
}
```
**Result:**
```json
{
  "message": "Found 3 matches",
  "output": "── forge/session/manager.py:159 ──
     156 |         ".a",
     157 |     }
     158 | 
>>>  159 |     def _should_summarize(self, filepath: str) -> bool:
     160 |         """Check if a file should be summarized (not binary, not forge metadata)"""
     161 |         # Skip forge metadata
     162 |         if filepath.startswith(".forge/"):

── forge/session/manager.py:489 ──
     486 |         # List files through VFS (includes any pending new files)
     487 |         files = self.vfs.list_files()
     488 |         # Filter out forge metadata and binary files
>>>  489 |         files = [f for f in files if self._should_summarize(filepath=f)]
     490 | 
     491 |         # Sort files breadth-first (by path depth, then alphabetically within each level)
     492 |         files.sort(key=lambda f: (self._get_path_depth(f), f))

── forge/session/manager.py:688 ──
     685 | 
     686 |         Returns the summary text, or None if the file shouldn't be summarized.
     687 |         """
>>>  688 |         if not self._should_summarize(filepath):
     689 |             return None
     690 | 
     691 |         # Read content from VFS (includes pending changes)",
  "success": true,
  "total_matches": 3
}
```
Looking at the `_should_summarize` method, I can see it filters files. Let me load the file to add `.json` to the skip list.

{"content": "     139 |         ".dll",
     140 |         ".so",
     141 |         ".dylib",
     142 |         ".bin",
     143 |         ".dat",
     144 |         # Other
     145 |         ".pdf",
     146 |         ".doc",
     147 |         ".docx",
     148 |         ".xls",
     149 |         ".xlsx",
     150 |         ".ppt",
     151 |         ".pptx",
     152 |         ".pyc",
     153 |         ".pyo",
     154 |         ".class",
     155 |         ".o",
     156 |         ".a",
     157 |     }
     158 | 
>>>  159 |     def _should_summarize(self, filepath: str) -> bool:
     160 |         """Check if a file should be summarized (not binary, not forge metadata)"""
     161 |         # Skip forge metadata
     162 |         if filepath.startswith(".forge/"):
     163 |             return False
     164 | 
     165 |         # Skip binary files by extension
     166 |         suffix = Path(filepath).suffix.lower()
     167 |         return suffix not in self._SKIP_EXTENSIONS
     168 | 
     169 |     def build_context(self) -> dict[str, Any]:
     170 |         """Build context for LLM with summaries and active files (legacy method)"""
     171 |         context = {"summaries": self.repo_summaries, "active_files": {}}
     172 | 
     173 |         # Add full content for active files
     174 |         for filepath in self.active_files:
     175 |             try:
     176 |                 content = self._repo.get_file_content(filepath, self.branch_name)
     177 |                 context["active_files"][filepath] = content
     178 |             except (FileNotFoundError, KeyError):
     179 |                 # File may have been deleted", "filepath": "forge/session/manager.py", "range": "139-179", "success": true, "target_line": 159, "total_lines": 735}

I can see the `_SKIP_EXTENSIONS` set is used to filter files. I'll add `.json` to it:

<edit file="forge/session/manager.py">
<search>
        ".pyc",
        ".pyo",
        ".class",
        ".o",
        ".a",
    }
</search>
<replace>
        ".pyc",
        ".pyo",
        ".class",
        ".o",
        ".a",
        # Data files
        ".json",
    }
</replace>
</edit>

Done! Added `.json` to the `_SKIP_EXTENSIONS` set, so JSON files will no longer be summarized.
